title: Saeidxyz
author: Saeidxyz
content: More than 2 months ago, CEX.io froze all my funds.They asked me for ID verification, which was completed successfully. Then they asked for showing the origin of the funds.I have sent all I could. At the end they said my case is under review by their complience team. And they will let me know if there is an update. Ever since they said that, 2 months has passed and their complience team still has not made any decisions. What kind of decisions can take that long?

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Send email message to their support again and ask for the reason for the delay. If you are legit and did nothing wrong, threaten them with law suit. If no or no good response from the exchange, consult your lawyer.If you did nothing wrong, they just want to steal your coins. Not your key not your coin.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: Saeidxyz on February 10, 2023, 08:18:58 PMWhat kind of decisions can take that long?Unfortunately, centralized exchanges can choose to do whatever they want because you entrusted them with your funds. This is why we always keep telling users never to trust centralized exchanges. Only use them momentarily where there is nee and remove your funds off them for long term storage.Try to send a PM to their representative - CEXThis is their Announcement thread - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=318010

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Keep following up their support, and ask to escalate this situation.Its too bad to experience this when you already comply with their requirements, and if they are still not responding maybe you can ask for a help legally to know your next step. This is a bad habit of a site to left their players hanging without updating you, your money is with them and they must release it if there’s no reason to hold it.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Have you tried posting on their subreddit about your issue? You can also contact one of their subreddit representative[1] and it seems that account is active solving ticket issues. You might want to follow up your concerns there.Apparently, by doing a quick search, it seems that there are some people experiencing delayed withdrawal issues and unresponsive support till now.[1] https://www.reddit.com/user/CEX_IO

comments.author: Saeidxyz
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on February 10, 2023, 08:26:31 PMSend email message to their support again and ask for the reason for the delay. If you are legit and did nothing wrong, threaten them with law suit. If no or no good response from the exchange, consult your lawyer.If you did nothing wrong, they just want to steal your coins. Not your key not your coin.Thanks for the replies.  Does anyone know of a law suit who could help with such cases?Thanks

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: it depends your country of residence, a law suit can be really expensive and during months if not years.personally I would interact first with a lawyer and try to understand some legal basis about these funds.maybe, it would be much more effective just a letter sent by him than a lawsuit etc etc (for sure I will take such action as last resort...)

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: Saeidxyz on February 11, 2023, 09:23:53 AMThanks for the replies.  Does anyone know of a law suit who could help with such cases?Thanks Since you're likely capable of it, look for some lawyers that deal with digital solutions and cases in your country. They are likely to help you file some cases or make a demand to cex.io to expedite the process that your funds are dealing with.This is their profile (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=148073) they're replying to the accusations that are thrown at them, maybe it'll help if you to contact this account.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Saeidxyz on February 11, 2023, 09:23:53 AMThanks for the replies.  Does anyone know of a law suit who could help with such cases?Thanks Have you tried contacting their representative profile on this forum linked above, or posted on their announcement thread? Based on their trust feedback page, it seems contacting them can help your case. Some users have deposit/withdrawal problems and it was solved according to them. Depending on what is actually going on with your funds I wouldn't be too hopeful though, but it seems worth doing compared to hiring a lawyer directly which may not help you at all due to different jurisdictions, etc.They are also quite active here, their last seen is just yesterday. So, there is definitely a chance that they will read and respond to your message.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Saeidxyz on February 11, 2023, 09:23:53 AMThanks for the replies.  Does anyone know of a law suit who could help with such cases?Thanks Just like I have said before, you have to meet your lawyer about this and he will be the one that will tell you what to do. I think $26000 is huge enough for a reason to think to be in suit with the exchange.

comments.author: Saeidxyz
comments.body: Quote from: blockman on February 11, 2023, 05:46:09 PMQuote from: Saeidxyz on February 11, 2023, 09:23:53 AMThanks for the replies.  Does anyone know of a law suit who could help with such cases?Thanks Since you're likely capable of it, look for some lawyers that deal with digital solutions and cases in your country. They are likely to help you file some cases or make a demand to cex.io to expedite the process that your funds are dealing with.This is their profile (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=148073) they're replying to the accusations that are thrown at them, maybe it'll help if you to contact this account.Thank you all guys. I will try

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: Saeidxyz on February 13, 2023, 08:48:23 AMQuote from: blockman on February 11, 2023, 05:46:09 PMQuote from: Saeidxyz on February 11, 2023, 09:23:53 AMThanks for the replies.  Does anyone know of a law suit who could help with such cases?Thanks Since you're likely capable of it, look for some lawyers that deal with digital solutions and cases in your country. They are likely to help you file some cases or make a demand to cex.io to expedite the process that your funds are dealing with.This is their profile (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=148073) they're replying to the accusations that are thrown at them, maybe it'll help if you to contact this account.Thank you all guys. I will tryYou're welcome and good luck to you. If you have no more questions, it's time for you to lock this thread and just get back to it and unlock it again when you want to update this thread.Hoping that you'll get some good updates regarding your stuck funds there because I've seen that some users before were able to get back their funds after seeking help from the community.

comments.author: CEX
comments.body: We respect your decision to share your experience and are very sorry this situation caused you inconvenience.Our mission at CEX.IO is to safely connect people to opportunities in cryptocurrencies and decentralized finance, serving as a guide alongside their personal journey. We take this responsibility seriously. We value the trust placed in us. There are no shortcuts in our operations or ethics.Throughout our company’s history, effective and trusted collaboration with global regulators has always been a top priority. Our teams are constantly working to maintain our compliance with evolving regulatory requirements and financial industry standards. You may learn more here: cex.io/legal-securityLet us know your UserID please and we’ll check the status of your case with the team. We haven't got any PMs from you so feel free to drop. us one with the info.Thanks for your cooperation in advance and we're looking forward to hearing from you.

comments.author: Saeidxyz
comments.created_time: February 16, 2023, 11:25:23 AMLast edit: February 16, 2023, 12:56:00 PM by Saeidxyz
comments.body: This is my User ID: up150905957I just need to know how much longer should I wait?Also please let me know why it has to take so long?What kind of decision making takes 2 months?Even the most complicated political matters don't take that long to resolve.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: If you already send all the proof to them it should not wait that long and I dont now if there is people that using Cex.io, If I were you I will definitely ask again to them email or the best way is creating a thread on their social media like twitter.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: Saeidxyz on February 16, 2023, 12:56:33 PMThis is my User ID: up150905957I just need to know how much longer should I wait?Also please let me know why it has to take so long?What kind of decision making takes 2 months?Even the most complicated political matters don't take that long to resolve.If you don't mind could either of you also inform us when the issue gets resolved because i am assuming it didn't get resolved. I don't have currently any money in CEX.io but i have an account in there and depending on the time this gets resolved affects if i want to use their service in the future.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: o48o on February 21, 2023, 08:19:55 PMIf you don't mind could either of you also inform us when the issue gets resolved because i am assuming it didn't get resolved. I don't have currently any money in CEX.io but i have an account in there and depending on the time this gets resolved affects if i want to use their service in the future. Both of them (CEX representative and OP) has been offline for a few days now, I think you will need to wait for a while until this gets resolved (if it ever will). Why don't you move to other services in the first place? I don't think there is a need to stick with CEX.IO since you have no money there. If you want to trade your BTC for altcoin there are tons of options out there. If I remember correctly some members mention Kucoin if no KYC is what you're looking for. It still works but don't expect it to last forever. If fiat is what you're looking for you can also use dex. Just a little bit complicated but should give you better control over your money.

It still works but don't expect it to last forever. If fiat is what you're looking for you can also use dex. Just a little bit complicated but should give you better control over your money.We know that there are some platforms which doesnt list out a specific coin and this is why people do end up on dealing with platforms which arent supposed to be deal off with.Speaking about in between negotiations between op and cex representative, then we dont know if the problem had already got resolved or not.One of the things i do really get worried about when depositing huge amounts of money on any centralized platform is that they could potentiallyhold it up and say some issues which is bullshit actually.

Just a little bit complicated but should give you better control over your money.Sorry for my late reply.Unfortunately the problem is not resolved yet.I have contacted a law suit in UK.I have already paid them 1000 USD for preparing a demand letter and starting negotiations with them.I could not wait any longer. I will definitely let you know if I get any more updates.
